items.title: Chemistry: Science for Energy and Sustainability (track)
items.lead: Science for Energy and Sustainability (SES) is an two-year interdisciplinary track within the Master's programmes Chemistry and Physics and Astronomy. It combines ‘hard’ scientific research with the analysis of societal issues, business models and government regulations. It is a joint degree programme with the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam so you will benefit from the expertise, networks and research projects at both universities.

items.title: Law & Finance (LLM)
items.lead: How can some banks and states become too big to-fail? Why do companies need financial lawyers to produce self-driving cars? These are questions about the relevance of law for finance. Attending this LLM programme, you will learn to answer them, and why they matter to you both as an individual and as a member of society.

items.title: Logic
items.lead: Logic is an interdisciplinary and international two-year Master's programme that focuses on the central role of logic as mediator between the sciences and the humanities. The MSc Logic enjoys a strong international reputation as an excellent research training programme. Graduates of the programme frequently move on to become key players in the international logical research community.

items.title: Physics and Astronomy (joint degree UvA/VU)
items.lead: The Master's programme Physics and Astronomy focuses both on fundamental research and its applications. You learn to test, explain and develop theories on physical phenomena, to conduct and evaluate experiments and astronomical observations, and to analyse and solve problems using scientific methods. The programme combines a broad understanding of physics and astronomy in general with in-depth knowledge of specific physics areas.

items.title: Stochastics and Financial Mathematics
items.lead: Stochastics and Financial Mathematics is a research-oriented two-year Master's programme in mathematics. Its strong focus on finance and its close ties with the financial and consultancy sector in the Amsterdam area are unique in the Netherlands. This programme is highly valued by the professional field for its top-level theoretical education in areas ranging from Financial Mathematics, Data Analytics and Statistics to Probability and Decision Making.

items.title: Information Studies: Data Science (track)
items.lead: In a data rich world, data science is gaining a central position with an increasing potential value for businesses, science and society. Data scientists are needed to give meaning to the sea of data that surrounds us. With the innovative and interdisciplinary Data Science track in the Information Studies Master's Programme, the UvA makes it possible for you to become a skillful expert in this field.

items.title: International Trade and Investment Law (International and European Law)
items.lead: Brexit, trade wars, China’s Belt and Road Initiative, new trade and investment agreements – the rules that govern the global economy are changing fast. In this LLM programme, students learn to operate, analyse, and debate the international legal framework that sustains, ordains, and contains the global economy.

items.title: Chemistry: Molecular Sciences (track)
items.lead: The two-year track Molecular Sciences in the Chemistry Master’s programme, a joint degree programme with the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, covers areas in chemistry that traditionally are associated with organic and inorganic chemistry, catalysis, physical chemistry and theoretical chemistry.

items.title: Information Studies: Information Systems (track)
items.lead: The Information Systems (IS) track in the Master's programme Information Studies is designed to give you the tools to analyse and create systems for the supply, storage and communication of information. IS is based on the intelligent communication between humans and information systems.

items.title: Computer Science (joint degree UvA/VU)
items.lead: In the Master's programme Computer Science you are taught by scientists who have a reputation for world-class research on computer systems, software, networking and online systems. As a joint degree programme of UvA and VU, you benefit from the expertise of both research groups at both institutions and their international contacts.

items.title: Biological Sciences: General Biology (track)
items.lead: The two-year track General Biology in the Master’s programme Biological Sciences is designed for students who do not wish to restrict their focus to one subject in the field of biology. Your study may cover topics such as the molecular mechanisms of a virus or the population dynamics of African elephants.

items.title: Information Studies
items.lead: Information studies is a broad and interdisciplinary field, primarily concerned with the analysis, collection, classification, manipulation, storage, retrieval and dissemination of information. It examines the interaction between people, organisations and any existing information systems, with the aim of creating, replacing, improving or understanding information systems.

items.title: Software Engineering
items.lead: You already know how to code. And over the years you've gained the necessary theoretical and practical experience. But you want more. You want to take your qualities as a software engineer to the next level. To work with other software engineers on realistic, complicated issues. To solve isolated technical problems, but also to operate within the whole dynamic and extensive field that software engineering is. To not just know the how, but to understand the why.

items.title: Mathematics
items.lead: In the two-year research-based Master's programme you are invited to deepen your mathematical knowledge and specialise in a mathematical area of your interest. You can also challenge yourself to study related disciplines such as physics, logic and computational science from a mathematical perspective. With the opportunity to compile a curriculum that is tailored to your personal interests, the world of Mathematics is your oyster.

items.title: Earth Sciences
items.lead: Global change, the increasing demand for scarce resources and the degradation and pollution of landscape, soil and water means that we need skilled professionals of earth sciences now more than ever. Professionals who understand the earth as a complex system and are able to lead the way towards a more sustainable future.

items.title: Forensic Science
items.lead: The Master's programme in Forensic Science is unique in the Netherlands. The programme distinguishes itself from most international Master's programmes in Forensic Science by building on a range of scientific backgrounds and disciplines, such as computer science, physics, chemistry, biological sciences and mathematics. The goal of the programme is to train good scientists, armed with forensic knowledge and professional skills. Do you want to make your scientific knowledge socially relevant within the context of law and order? Then you should apply for Forensic Science.

items.title: International Criminal Law - Joint Program with Columbia Law School (International Criminal Law)
items.lead: Amsterdam Law School offers two Master tracks International Criminal Law: a joint program with Columbia Law School (track 1) and a full LLM in International and Transnational Criminal Law at our Amsterdam Law School (track 2).  Both tracks focus on international and transnational criminal law as distinct fields of legal study. We aim to train a new style of criminal lawyers who are capable of transcending disciplinary borders, by offering a broad and deep understanding of relevant issues of international and cross-border justice and supporting the development of academic skills through the in-depth analysis.

items.title: European Private Law (LLM)
items.lead: Would you like to look beyond the letter of the law – discuss the justice and politics of private law rules? Do you want to challenge yourself to become the best private lawyer you can be? Learn to solve private law issues across European jurisdictions? Come and study European Private Law at the University of Amsterdam.

items.title: Biological Sciences: Freshwater & Marine Biology (track)
items.lead: Water covers about 70% of our planet. It plays an important role in the global climate and is a source of food, minerals, energy and recreation. Aquatic ecosystems teem with organisms, ranging from tiny phytoplankton and zooplankton to coral, fish, and whales. Unfortunately, aquatic ecosystems are also used as ‘dumping grounds' for much of society's waste and are profoundly affected by global change. In the Master's track Freshwater and Marine Biology these topics are investigated from different perspectives, ranging from molecular studies to laboratory experiments and field investigations, long-term monitoring and the development of advanced mathematical models.

items.title: Earth Sciences: Future Planet Ecosystem Science (track)
items.lead: In the two-year track Future Planet Ecosystem Science of the Master’s programme Earth Sciences, you will learn quantitative methods and gain an in-depth understanding of concepts of geo-ecological systems, essential to face the grand challenges regarding global change, the management of ecosystems, and their services upon which humans rely.

items.title: European Union Law (International and European Law)
items.lead: Many of today’s challenges demand a response from EU law. As the most sophisticated international organization in the world the EU deals with issues like (mass) migration, climate change and cybercrime. This programme gives you the tools to unlock the many fields of EU law and to critically reflect on them.

items.title: Earth Sciences: Environmental Management (track)
items.lead: This Master's track combines an education in geo-ecological science with interdisciplinary skills. You will learn to apply your knowledge of earth sciences in a professional setting and are trained to tackle environmental problems while working in teams with other specialists.

items.title: Computational Science (joint degree UvA/VU)
items.lead: In the Master's programme Computational Science you learn to develop computational models based on observations and data from physical, social, earth, economic and life sciences. In this joint degree of UvA and VU you can specialise in topics offered by both universities.

items.title: International and Transnational Criminal Law (International Criminal Law)
items.lead: Amsterdam Law School offers two tracks of a Master’s programme in International Criminal Law. Track 1 is International Criminal Law – Joint programme, together with Columbia Law School. Track 2 is International and Transnational Criminal Law, a full LLM at Amsterdam Law School.  Both tracks train a new style of criminal lawyers who are capable of transcending disciplinary borders, by offering a broad and deep understanding of relevant issues of international justice and supporting the development of academic skills through the in-depth analysis.

items.title: Earth Sciences: Geo-ecological Dynamics (track)
items.lead: In the track Geo-ecological Dynamics you will deepen your understanding of the different processes that play an important role in the functioning of geo-ecological systems that are strongly affected by global change. At scales varying from the molecule to the globe, you will study the dynamics of landscapes and geo-ecosystems of terrestrial environments and adjacent aquatic systems based on fieldwork, in the laboratory, with computational methods, or a combination of these.

items.title: Physics and Astronomy: Biophysics and Biophotonics (track)
items.lead:
In the two-year track Biophysics and Biophotonics in the Master’s programme Physics and Astronomy, a joint degree with the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, you will use the language of physics to explore the secrets of life processes. 

This Master's track was formerly known as Physics of Life and Health.

items.title: Public International Law (International and European Law)
items.lead: Can the EU impose sanctions on Russia for its alleged involvement in the downing of MH-17? Do human rights treaties apply when armed forces operate abroad? In today’s globalized world, problems and challenges increasingly transcend national boundaries. Climate change, terrorism, trade wars, refugees and mass migration are examples of issues that require global solutions, and international law is an important tool to achieve and implement those solutions.

items.title: Physics and Astronomy: Gravitation, Astro-, and Particle Physics (track)
items.lead: The two-year track Gravitation, Astro-, and Particle Physics (GRAPPA) in the Master’s programme Physics and Astronomy, a joint degree with the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, stands at at the intersection of theoretical physics, experimental (astro)particle physics and astrophysics. Students benefit from a highly collaborative international research environment. Current research topics include gravitational waves, collider-based particle physics experiments and dark matter detection, and staff is involved in several large international research projects.

items.title: Physics and Astronomy: Theoretical Physics (track)
items.lead: Einstein, Bohr, Feynman, Hawking... Theoretical physics has captured the imagination for many generations. The two-year track Theoretical Physics in the Master’s programme Physics and Astronomy, a joint degree with the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, offers education and training from researchers of one of Europe's leading institutes in this challenging and exciting field. Requiring a high level of conceptual and technical sophistication, it seeks to answer deeply fundamental questions such as: What is matter made of? What is the nature of space and time?

items.title: Medical Informatics
items.lead: The MSc in Medical Informatics aims to be the gateway for ambitious students with an entrepreneurial, global mindset to a career at the interface of healthcare and ICT. They will gain a deep understanding of healthcare processes and ICT technologies and challenged to solve real-life cases from our clinical and corporate health ICT partners. This all takes place at a vibrant academic hospital: the Amsterdam UMC in Amsterdam.

items.title: Security and Network Engineering
items.lead: The Master’s programme Security and Network Engineering (SNE, formerly System and Netwerk Engineering) is a time intensive one year programme at the University of Amsterdam (UvA). It allows students to specialise in Security and Network Engineering on a more theoretical level. With security as a focal point in the programme for the last thirteen years, it prepares students for realistic situations outside of academics.

items.title: Chemistry (joint degree UvA/VU)
items.lead: The Master's programme Chemistry, a joint degree with Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, provides you with a highly qualified background of theory and practice in chemistry and sufficient specialisation in a specific field. It exposes you to research at the front line of this exciting, multifaceted discipline that forms the bridge between biology at one end of the spectrum, and physics and mathematics at the other. Globally, chemistry is acknowledged as playing a key role in social and economic progress. The Chemistry Master's programme can be done both in full-time and part-time.

items.title: Pedagogical Sciences: Youth at Risk (track)
items.lead: Are you interested in how social contexts affect the development of children, adolescents and young adults? Do you want to make a difference in the well-being of young people? The Master’s track Youth at Risk prepares you to become a scientist-practitioner in the field of preventive youth care, parenting and education, to enhance the development of youth at risk.

items.title: Physics and Astronomy: Astronomy and Astrophysics (track)
items.lead: The two-year track Astronomy and Astrophysics in the Master’s programme Physics and Astronomy, a joint degree with the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, provides you with thorough training in both the observational and theoretical aspects of modern astronomy and astrophysics. The dynamic field of astronomy and astrophysics is currently gaining importance worldwide. New generations of instruments - situated on the earth's surface and in space - enable us to study the origin, structure and evolution of planets, stars, star systems, and the universe in a more profound way than ever before.

items.title: Physics and Astronomy: Science for Energy and Sustainability (track)
items.lead: Science for Energy and Sustainability (SfES) is an interdisciplinary track within the UvA Master's programmes Chemistry and Physics and Astronomy.  Each discipline contributes courses that can be selected allowing a programme geared towards only physics, a mixture of physics and chemistry or supplemented with courses dealing with societal aspects  of sustainability. It's a joint degree programme of the University of Amsterdam and Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam.

items.title: Physics and Astronomy: Advanced Matter and Energy Physics (track)
items.lead: The two-year track Advanced Matter and Energy Physics in the Master’s programme Physics and Astronomy, a joint degree with the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, is among the best experimental physics programmes in the world. It offers you challenging courses and research opportunities in hot topics in laboratories around the world and prepares you for an exciting career in research.

items.title: Biological Sciences: Green Life Sciences (track)
items.lead: The  two-year track Green Life Sciences in the Biological Sciences Master’s programme is a research oriented programme that focuses on studying plants and their interactions with the environment at the molecular level. The study programme gives you the opportunity to combine fundamental and applied training in molecular biology, chemical ecology, ecogenomics, biotechnology, plant breeding, phytopathology, pest control, cell and population biology. This enables you to develop an integrated view of the functioning of plants and to gain skills required for modern research.

items.title: Chemistry: Analytical Sciences (track)
items.lead: In the two-year track Analytical Sciences of the Master’s programme Chemistry, a joint degree programme with Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, you will focus purely on aspects of analytical chemistry, such as modern analytical techniques, general concepts and strategies for analysis and various application fields.

items.title: Bioinformatics and Systems Biology (joint degree UvA/VU)
items.lead: Both Bioinformatics and Systems Biology are strongly interdisciplinary fields. This Master's programme combines molecular and cell biology, computer science and mathematical modelling to integrate vast amounts of biological data into fundamental knowledge. You will develop a strong feel for scientific research and high levels of abstraction, and learn to combine the rapid developments in these fields.

items.title: Biological Sciences: Ecology and Evolution (track)
items.lead: The aim of the two-year track Ecology and Evolution in the Master's programme Biological Sciences is to promote understanding of the relationships between living organisms, the evolution of species and the function of ecosystems, in order to contribute to more sustainability on earth.

items.title: Artificial Intelligence
items.lead: Self-driving cars, smart cameras, surveillance systems, robotic manufacturing and machine translations: examples of how artificial intelligence has become integrated in society. In the highly competitive two-year Master’s programme Artificial Intelligence (AI) you will develop a solid understanding of AI and become an expert in a rapidly evolving discipline.

items.title: European Competition Law and Regulation (International and European Law)
items.lead: Should social networks offering free services such as Facebook be subject to intervention by competition authorities? Can Member States’ measures combatting climate change be tolerated under EU state aid rules? Questions like these will be discussed during the Master’s track European Competition Law and Regulation.

items.title: Biological Sciences*
items.lead: Biological Sciences at the UvA is a challenging Master's programme with world-renowned research on plant and animal species and the ecosystems to which they belong. It invites you to explore the options to sustainably use and protect the earth’s biodiversity. Your Master’s diploma qualifies for excellent positions both in- and outside the academia, anywhere in the world.

items.title: Biomedical Sciences: Neurobiology tracks*
items.lead: Biomedical Sciences: Neurobiology at the UvA is a challenging Master's programme. It is positioned at the interface between biology, psychology and philosophy. Your Master’s diploma qualifies for excellent positions both in- and outside the academia, anywhere in the world.

items.title: Biomedical Sciences: Medical Biology tracks
items.lead: Biomedical Sciences: Medical Biology at the UvA is a challenging Master's programme where you acquire thorough knowledge of the cellular, molecular and biochemical basis of medical pathologies. Your Master’s diploma qualifies for excellent positions both in- and outside the academia, anywhere in the world.

items.title: Biomedical Sciences**
items.lead: The Master's programme in Biomedical Sciences is a two-year programme. It offers two clusters and is closely affiliated with the University of Amsterdam Academic Medical Center (AMC-UvA) and the Swammerdam Institute for Life Sciences (SILS).

items.title: Information Law (LLM) - Students can no longer enrol
items.lead: Information is the central building block of markets and societies. New ways of creating, disseminating and using information impacts the workings of democracy, science and education, and creativity and culture. Reliance on personal data and personalised online services affects individuals and their human rights. As a result, new and important issues are emerging for which our laws are not optimally adapted.

items.title: Public International Law (LLM) - Students can no longer enrol
items.lead: The two-year Research Master’s programme in Public International Law aims to give students knowledge and understanding of the fundamental principles of public international law, with a particular focus on key areas of the international rule of law.

items.title: Child Development and Education
items.lead: The Research Master's in Child Development and Education is an intensive, selective two-year programme that trains students to become researchers in the field of parenting, education and child development.

items.title: Brain and Cognitive Sciences
items.lead: The Research Master's programme in Brain and Cognitive Sciences at the University of Amsterdam offers a broad selection of tracks that investigate all aspects of the field, from the molecule to the mind. The programme is unique in its interdisciplinary perspective that incorporates the fields of neuroscience, neurology, psychology, behavioural economics, linguistics, logic, computation and philosophy. The brain is an immensely powerful and intricate processing device dedicated to the selection, perception, transformation and storage of the indispensable information we use to interact with our ever-changing, dynamic environment.

items.title: Commerciële rechtspraktijk (Privaatrecht)
items.lead: Deze master bereidt je voor op de commerciële rechtspraktijk. Je verdiept en verbreedt je kennis van ondernemingsrecht en nauw verwante vakgebieden zoals financieel recht en insolventierecht. Daarnaast doe je via simulaties ervaring op met echte casussen, zodat je na je master klaar bent voor de praktijk.

items.title: Fiscaal recht
items.lead: De master Fiscaal recht is opgebouwd rond het centrale thema ondernemerschap. Je verdiept je in de werking van de fiscale regels en wetten en leert wat belastingen betekenen voor ondernemers en hun ondernemingen. Het is de ideale opleiding voor functies in de Nederlandse belastingpraktijk.

items.title: Geneeskunde
items.lead:
De artsopleiding bestaat uit een driejarige bachelor geneeskunde, gevolgd door een eveneens driejarige master.

In onderstaande tekst wordt uitleg gegeven over de Master Geneeskunde Curius+.

items.title: Geneeskunde en Biomedical Sciences (dubbele master)
items.lead: Ben je 3e jaars student Dubbele Bachelor (DuBa) Geneeskunde en Biomedische wetenschappen of heb je eerder een biomedische of psychobiologische bachelor gedaan? Dan is de Dubbele Master (DuMa) Geneeskunde en Biomedical Sciences misschien wat voor jou!

items.title: Pedagogische wetenschappen: Orthopedagogiek (track)
items.lead: Orthopedagogen bestuderen hoe leer-, ontwikkelings- en opvoedingsproblemen bij kinderen zich manifesteren en wat er in de opvoeding en op school moet gebeuren om deze aan te pakken en te behandelen. Zij houden zich bezig met ernstige problemen bij kinderen zoals depressie, angst en agressie, maar ook met opvoedingsproblemen veroorzaakt door bijvoorbeeld chronische ziektes, verstandelijke beperkingen, pedagogische onmacht of mishandeling.

items.title: Onderwijswetenschappen
items.lead: Onderwijswetenschappen is een multidisciplinaire opleiding gericht op het verbeteren van de kwaliteit van onderwijs. In een kennissamenleving als de onze is goed onderwijs essentieel.

items.title: Tandheelkunde
items.lead: De master Tandheelkunde duurt drie jaar. Je specialiseert en kwalificeert je in een van de specialisatierichtingen waarop je je in de bachelor al hebt georiënteerd.

items.title: Pedagogische wetenschappen: Forensische orthopedagogiek (track)
items.lead: In 2007 was de Universiteit van Amsterdam de eerste Nederlandse universiteit om een mastertrack Forensische orthopedagogiek aan te bieden: een volledig programma waarin forensisch orthopedagogische vraagstukken centraal staan. Docenten werken intensief samen met de klinische praktijk wat tot uiting komt in de sterk ontwikkelde klinische lijn binnen de master.

items.title: Arbeidsrecht
items.lead: Het arbeidsrecht is continu in beweging. Zijn Deliveroo-bezorgers of Uber-chauffeurs bijvoorbeeld werknemers of zelfstandigen? En hebben zij recht op sociale zekerheid bij arbeidsongeschiktheid of moeten zij dat zelf regelen? In deze master ga je op zoek naar een oplossing voor dit soort maatschappelijke vraagstukken.

items.title: Staats- en bestuursrecht (Publiekrecht)
items.lead: De mastertrack Staats- en Bestuursrecht (Publiekrecht) is praktijkgericht en academisch verdiepend. Het is daardoor een opleiding met veel toekomstperspectief.

items.title: Arbeid en onderneming (Arbeidsrecht)
items.lead: Fusies, overnames en reorganisaties zijn aan de orde van de dag. Mag een overnemende partij na een overname het personeel ontslaan? Welke bescherming genieten werknemers als een onderneming failliet gaat? In de mastertrack Arbeid en onderneming bekijk je dit soort vragen vanuit verschillende perspectieven.

items.title: Informatierecht
items.lead: Hoe draagt intellectueel eigendomsrecht bij aan technologische innovatie en de beschikbaarheid van informatieproducten en -diensten? Wat zijn de grenzen aan de vrijheid van meningsuiting online? Hoe wordt je privacy gewaarborgd door apps tegen het coronavirus? Welke juridische middelen kunnen ingezet worden om desinformatie te bestrijden? Wanneer is een internetplatform aansprakelijk voor illegale content van gebruikers? Wat is de impact van Artificial Intelligence op het intellectueel eigendomsrecht en het informatierecht en welke regels gaan hierover? Dit zijn bij uitstek vragen die aan de orde komen in de master Informatierecht.

items.title: Strafrecht (Publiekrecht)
items.lead: Hoe ver mag de overheid gaan in het ontwikkelen van opsporingstechnieken die ingrijpen in de persoonlijke levenssfeer? Hoe moet strafrechtelijk worden omgegaan met terugkerende Syriëgangers? Dit soort maatschappelijk en rechtsstatelijk relevante vraagstukken komt aan de orde in de mastertrack Strafrecht.

items.title: Gezondheidsrecht
items.lead: Wat denk jij: is de overheid verplicht nieuwe geneesmiddelen altijd te vergoeden? Heeft een patiënt recht op euthanasie? Onderzoek deze en andere kwesties tijdens de nieuwe master Gezondheidsrecht. Zoek de verdieping op in het gevarieerde programma met nieuwe vakken en een aangepast curriculum.

items.title: Pedagogische wetenschappen: Preventieve jeugdhulp en opvoeding (track)
items.lead:
Er is grote behoefte binnen gezinnen, in de kinderopvang, op scholen en in de maatschappij om problemen in opvoeding te voorkomen, te signaleren en op te lossen.

Binnen de mastertrack Preventieve jeugdhulp en opvoeding (voorheen Opvoedingsondersteuning) word je opgeleid om op een academisch verantwoorde manier pedagogische vraagstukken in verschillende beroepsvelden op te lossen. Speciale aandacht gaat uit naar situaties waarin door opvoeders, instellingen of overheden acties ondernomen moeten worden om de ontwikkelingskansen van de jeugd te vergroten en om problemen bij kinderen en jongeren te voorkomen, te signaleren of op te lossen.

items.title: Internationaal en Europees belastingrecht (Fiscaal recht)
items.lead: Bij de mastertrack Internationaal en Europees belastingrecht ligt de focus op de fiscale problematiek van het grensoverschrijdend ondernemen. Wat betekent dit bijvoorbeeld voor multinationals? Wil je een internationale loopbaan waarbij je advies geeft aan en over het internationale bedrijfsleven? Dan is dit de ideale studie.

items.title: Privaatrechtelijke rechtspraktijk (Privaatrecht)
items.lead: Wie is aansprakelijk voor de schade wanneer een zelfrijdende auto een ongeluk veroorzaakt? Geldt er een bedenktijd wanneer je iets koopt op een online-veiling? In deze mastertrack verdiep je je in deze en andere vraagstukken en bereid je je grondig voor op de privaatrechtelijke loopbaan die jij ambieert.

items.lead: Master of Arts Leraar Voorbereidend Hoger Onderwijs in de Taal en Cultuurwetenschappen, track Latijnse Taal en Cultuur

items.lead: Master of Arts Leraar Voorbereidend Hoger Onderwijs in de Taal en Cultuurwetenschappen, track Hebreeuws

items.lead: Master of Arts Leraar Voorbereidend Hoger Onderwijs in de Taal en Cultuurwetenschappen, track Grieks, Latijn en Klassieke Culturele Vorming

items.lead: Master of Arts Leraar Voorbereidend Hoger Onderwijs in de Taal en Cultuurwetenschappen, track Frans

items.lead: Master of Arts Leraar Voorbereidend Hoger Onderwijs in de Taal en Cultuurwetenschappen, track Engels

items.title: Lerarenopleiding Godsdienst en levensbeschouwing
items.lead: Master of Arts Leraar Voorbereidend Hoger Onderwijs in de Mens- en Maatschappijwetenschappen, track Godsdienst en Levensbeschouwing

items.title: Lerarenopleiding Kunstgeschiedenis en Culturele en Kunstzinnige Vorming/Kunst Algemeen
items.lead: Master of Arts Leraar Voorbereidend Hoger Onderwijs in de Mens- en Maatschappijwetenschappen, track Kunstgeschiedenis en Culturele en Kunstzinnige Vorming/Kunst Algemeen

items.title: Lerarenopleiding Biologie
items.lead: Master of Science Leraar Voorbereidend Hoger Onderwijs in de Bètawetenschappen, track Biologie

items.title: Executive Master of Finance & Control
items.lead: Ben jij een ambitieuze finance-professional die de (digitale) transformatie van de financiële functie mee wil vormgeven om de business optimaal te ondersteunen? Ontdek dan wat de parttime Executive Master of Finance & Control (EMFC) voor jouw carrière doet en wat deze RC-opleiding van de Universiteit van Amsterdam uniek maakt.

items.title: Executive MSc in Insurance & Risk: Enterprise Risk Management
items.lead: Enterprise Risk Management is een afstudeervariant van de Executive MSc in Insurance & Risk. Studeer ERM als methode om inzicht te krijgen in alle risico’s die een organisatie bedreigen.

items.title: Executive MSc in Insurance & Risk
items.lead: De Executive MSc in Insurance & Risk is de enige opleiding waarin je op academisch niveau jouw kennis over verzekeringen verbreedt en verdiept. Deze parttime master biedt je een multidisciplinair programma waarin zowel een breed scala aan theoretische onderdelen als praktijkcolleges een belangrijke rol spelen. Ben je geïnteresseerd in risicomanagement? Kies dan voor de afstudeervariant Enterprise Risk Management. Ook kun je een losse module of short track uit het masterprogramma volgen.

items.title: Bedrijfskunde in deeltijd
items.lead: Wat maakt bedrijven succesvol? En hoe kun je het succes van je eigen organisatie verbeteren? Combineer werk en studie en haal in 1,5 jaar je Master (MSc) in Bedrijfskunde. Je kunt kiezen uit de tracks Digital Business, Strategy en Leadership & Management.

items.title: Executive MSc of Internal Auditing
items.lead: Met de parttime Executive MSc of Internal Auditing (EMIA) ben je in 2 tot 2,5 jaar gecertificeerd internal auditor (RO). Je leert audittechnieken optimaal beheersen en doet gedegen kennis op van onderwerpen als data science, risk management en governance. Na deze opleiding beschik je over de vaktechnische-  en leidinggevende capaciteiten voor functies als (senior) Manager Internal Auditing of  Chief Audit Executive (CAE).

items.title: Control in deeltijd
items.lead: Ben je financieel professional? Wil je je carrièreperspectief vergroten met een MSc-diploma, en inhoudelijk sterker worden in je vakgebied? Volg dan de MSc Control in deeltijd. Je volgt colleges op vrijdag. In januari ben je vrij, zodat je je dan optimaal op je werk kunt concentreren.

items.title: Actuarial Science and Mathematical Finance in deeltijd
items.lead: De MSc Actuarial Science and Mathematical Finance (ASMF) in deeltijd is een multidisciplinaire masteropleiding. Je richt je op kwantitatieve modellen van levensverzekeringen, schadeverzekeringen en pensioenfondsen. Je ontwikkelt een wetenschappelijke visie op het vakgebied, doordat we veel aandacht besteden aan de theoretische basis. Het programma bereidt je voor op de Postmaster Actuarial Practice Cycle.

items.title: Accountancy in deeltijd
items.lead: Ben je financieel professional? Wil je je carrièreperspectief vergroten met een MSc-diploma, en inhoudelijk sterker worden in je vakgebied? Volg dan de MSc Accountancy in deeltijd. Je volgt colleges op vrijdag. In januari ben je vrij, zodat je je dan optimaal op je werk kunt concentreren.

items.title: Communication Science: Research Master's (Professional)
items.lead: Would you like to resolve communication challenges in practice rather than just study them? The Research Master’s (Professional track) in Communication Science is a two-year MSc degree programme for students who would like to be at the forefront of the newest developments in understanding the role of communication and media in an applied context.

items.title: Communication Science: Research Master's (Academic)
items.lead: Would you like to create new knowledge rather than just study it? The Research Master’s in Communication Science is a two-year MSc degree programme for students who would like to be at the forefront of the newest developments in understanding the role of communication and media in society.

items.title: Communication Science: Entertainment Communication
items.lead: Entertainment Communication is a track of the Master's in Communication Science and focuses on the experience, role, and impact of entertainment media on a range of different groups and individuals.

items.title: Communication Science: Persuasive Communication
items.lead: The track Persuasive Communication of the Master's in Communication Science addresses communication processes that are intended to achieve specific persuasive goals in marketing and health communication.

items.title: Journalism, Media and Globalisation (Erasmus Mundus Master's - joint degree)
Communication Science: Corporate Communication
items.lead: The Corporate Communication track within the Master’s Programme in Communication Science gives a broad understanding of the communication of commercial and non-profit organisations with their environment and society.

items.title: Communication Science: Political Communication
items.lead: The Political Communication track is part of the Master's in Communication Science and addresses issues at the core of our democracies. It provides an understanding of the role and significance of media, journalism and information in shaping public opinion.

items.title: Psychology (research)
items.lead: The University of Amsterdam offers an outstanding two-year Research Master’s programme in Psychology. This programme is designed for excellent and motivated students with a genuine interest in psychological research, who are interested in a career in academic or applied (industry) research.

items.title: Psychology: Cultural Psychology (track)
items.lead: The Department of Social Psychology offers an English-speaking master’s programme in Cultural Psychology. We invite ambitious Dutch and international students with a genuine interest in (cross-) cultural psychology to apply for this selective, one-year programme.

items.title: Psychologie
items.lead: Volg één van de mastertracks bij Psychologie aan de Universiteit van Amsterdam (UvA). Psychologie studeren aan de UvA geeft je de mogelijkheid je te specialiseren in specifieke richtingen binnen het vakgebied.

items.title: Gezondheidszorgpsychologie
items.lead: Naast de eenjarige master Psychologie en de tweejarige Research Master, wordt de eenjarige master Gezondheidszorgpsychologie aangeboden. De eenjarige master Gezondheidszorgpsychologie staat in het teken van de klinische tracks.

items.title: Psychologie: Klinische Forensische Psychologie (track)
items.lead: De UvA mastertrack Klinische Forensische psychologie biedt specialistisch onderwijs om antisociaal gedrag bij volwassenen te begrijpen, te beoordelen, te voorspellen, en te voorkomen. De UvA master kiest voor specialisatie: Wij focussen op assessment en interventies van volwassen daders.

items.title: Psychologie: Klinische Neuropsychologie (track)
items.lead: Als neuropsycholoog bestudeer je de werking van de hersenen op gedragsniveau. Dat wil zeg­gen dat je je bezighoudt met de vraag hoe onze hersenen ons in staat stellen om waar te nemen, te denken, te voelen, te bewegen, en allerlei andere dingen te doen.

items.title: Psychology: Development and Health Psychology (track)
items.lead: Almost all children hate smoking, yet about a quarter of young adults take up smoking. What changed in-between childhood and adulthood and what can we do to prevent this behaviour? Similar questions can be asked for problematic use of drugs, or unprotected sex. Further, overweight and obesity, even in young children, is one of the most important health problems in the western world with an enormous socio-economic impact. What can we do about that?

items.title: Psychology: Human Resource & Career Management (track)
items.lead: This track focuses on personnel psychology, the discipline that examines individual processes within the organization. It is the study of how organisations hire and retain the right people for the right job.

items.title: Psychology: Consultancy & Organisational Development (track)
items.lead: The track focuses on organisational psychology; this discipline studies the relationship between employees and their social working environment (e.g., colleagues, supervisors, teams, organization as a whole).

items.title: Psychology: Sport and Performance Psychology
items.lead: What psychological processes are involved in peak performance? That is the main question in this Master’s track. This question is divided into two sub-questions (1) How do you help people perform at their best when it really matters? and (2) How do you help people reach very difficult goals?

items.title: Psychology: Coaching & Vitality in Organisations (track)
items.lead: The track focuses on occupational health psychology, more specifically the psychology of interventions that promote the well-being and functioning of people at work. The background, development, and application of work-related coaching and other interventions (including mindfulness) play a key role in this track. Students also learn how to develop evidence-based approaches, introduce interventions and apply coaching techniques.

items.title: Psychology: Behavioural Data Science (track)
items.lead: Understanding data about human behaviour is an important and valuable skill in today's society. Companies, public institutions and governmental organizations — they all use the continuous stream of big data to describe and predict human behaviour.

items.title: Psychology: Social Influence (track)
items.lead: Why are emotional appeals in advertising campaigns sometimes effective and sometimes not? How do we encourage fewer people to cycle in pedestrian areas? How do we study the effectiveness of measures to prevent tax evasion?

items.title: Psychology: Brain & Cognition in Society (track)
items.lead: Apply knowledge from the field of Brain and Cognitive Sciences to answer important societal questions. You learn to set up applied experiments, and to translate empirical findings into practical advice.

items.title: Psychologie: Klinische Ontwikkelingspsychologie (track)
items.lead: In het onderwijsprogramma van de specialisatie Klinische Ontwikkelingspsychologie (KLOP) ligt de nadruk op een gedegen inzicht in de klinische ontwikkelingspsychologie. Hierbij gaat het om een contextrijke ontwikkeling van kinderen, in gezin en school. Het programma bestrijkt de kinder- en jeugdjaren, de vroege jeugd en latere veroudering.

items.title: Urban and Regional Planning
items.lead: Learn to analyse, understand and address the social, ecological and economic challenges of contemporary cities. The Master's programme in Urban and Regional Planning will teach you the skills, tools and approaches to reinvent urban futures.

items.title: Sociology: Social Problems and Social Policy (track)
items.lead: Social Problems and Social Policy offers students insight into the ways in which issues are defined, placed on the agenda and made public. Social Problems and Social Policy considers policy as one way of dealing with social problems and offers a specific focus on welfare states, citizens and professionals.

items.title: International Relations (Political Science)
items.lead: Our International Relations programme provides you with insight into fundamental questions about war and peace, the global economy, but also about justice and identity throughout the world. It analyses interactions between states, international organizations, citizens and other non-state actors at local, national, and supranational levels. Examples of current affairs typical for studying international relations are Brexit, the threat of sanctions for Venezuela, influence and violence of IS, and refugee flows from Syria.

items.title: Cultural and Social Anthropology
items.lead: The Master’s programme in Cultural and Social Anthropology at the UvA is a broadly focused one-year Master’s programme in which you design and conduct high quality anthropological research. Questions of globalisation, identity and authenticity, migration, citizenship, but also of transnational relations, development, and myths of progress are at the heart of this programme.

items.title: Sociology: Gender, Sexuality and Society (track)
items.lead: The Gender, Sexuality, and Society (GSS) master track explores the significance of gender and sexuality in contemporary societies. This means we conduct theoretical investigations in which gender and sexuality are put firmly on the sociological agenda as crucial categories of analysis in accounting for social reality. It also means we explore themes such as the global crisis of care, homonationalism, non-heteronormative sexualities, and the rise of #metoo movements. We study gender and sexuality in their entanglement with class and race and other critical dimensions of power and inequality.

items.title: Political Science
items.lead: Political Science at the University of Amsterdam investigates how ongoing social, economic, and political transformations affect local, national, European and global governance. Political Science offers five different specialisations: International Relations, Public Policy and Governance, Political Economy, Political Theory and European Politics and External Relations.

items.title: Medical Anthropology and Sociology
items.lead: The Master’s programme in Medical Anthropology and Sociology focuses on health and healthcare in a political, economic and cultural context. In the Master’s programme in Medical Anthropology and Sociology, you will use social science theory and methods to critically analyse health issues in a globalising world.

items.title: Political Theory (Political Science)
items.lead: The Master’s programme in Political Theory will teach you political theory and applied philosophy in a theoretical, practical and analytical way. You are challenged to critically analyse and reflect on current political contexts and social and political thought.

items.title: Sociology: Comparative Organisation and Labour Studies (track)
items.lead: The Comparative Organisation and Labour Studies track offers students an insight into the organisation of work processes, the ways in which modern labour markets operate and the position of labour in the wider society.

items.title: Conflict Resolution and Governance
items.lead: The Master’s in Conflict Resolution and Governance offers you education on the broad spectrum of conflict resolution theory, research and practice. The causes, characteristics, significance and consequences of conflicts are studied in relation to the dynamics of public governance. You will learn how to analyse conflicts, negotiate their resolution and link conflict research with its practice.

items.title: European Politics and External Relations (Political Science)
items.lead: During our European Politics and External Relations Masters programme you will analyse politics, governance and power in Europe. The programme focuses on the European challenges as part of an increasingly globalized world. Both internal and external dimensions on EU policies will be addressed such as the economic crisis, security challenges, environmental issues, the refugee crisis, the rise of populism and trade. Our programme offers access to seminars, debates and high-level guest lectures from the Amsterdam Centre for European Studies (ACES) research community. During previous years, European Politics and External Relations track students were given the opportunity to attend a study trip to Brussels, which included meetings and discussions with key EU institutions providing them with several network opportunities.

items.title: Sociology: Migration and Ethnic Studies (track)
items.lead: The track Migration and Ethnic Studies analyses global migration and mobility as part of broader processes of societal change. The course teaches you how migration is linked with processes of social stratification, identity and diversity and economic change in countries of origin and destination, and prepares you for further research or a professional career.

items.title: Sociology
items.lead: The Master’s in Sociology at the University of Amsterdam offers a comprehensive programme focusing on urgent, contemporary social issues. The Master's programme in Sociology teaches you how to think sociologically about issues such as wage inequalities, migration, sexual diversity or urbanization.

items.title: Sociology: Urban Sociology (track)
items.lead: Urban Sociology Master's programme is all about hands-on research into the topics that are most current in thinking about cities: diversity, creativity, sustainability and justice.

items.title: International Development Studies
items.lead: In this Master’s programme you will examine global inequalities, ranging from their causes, characteristics and possible solutions. International Development Studies is concerned with a broad range of topics like poverty, conflict, security, social and gender inequality, sustainability, education, the environment and the relationship between local, national and global processes.

items.title: Sociology: Cultural Sociology (track)
items.lead: The Master’s programme in Cultural Sociology explores the social process of “meaning making”. It examines how people try to make sense of their worlds by telling stories, defining boundaries, creating categories or assigning value. It also studies how symbolic, meaningful cultural objects like books, artworks or clothing are produced, distributed and received in fields of cultural production.

items.title: Public Policy and Governance (Political Science)
items.lead: In the Master’s in Public Policy and Governance you will learn to critically analyse public policies in often controversial political settings. The programme focuses on both research and practice and links theory and practice by looking into interesting cases and inviting inspiring guest speakers.

items.title: Economic Geography (Human Geography)
items.lead: The Master Economic Geography focuses on how the globalised economy has affected the lives of people in different parts of the world. Processes of globalisation are deeply intertwined with changes in communication and transport technologies as well as with policies of de- and re-regulation. We will not only explore economic aspects of increasingly globalised production networks, but also their social impact.

items.title: Human Geography
items.lead: The Master Human Geography at the University of Amsterdam has a focus on urban and political geographies. The programme offers four specialisations: Economic Geography, Environmental Geography, Political Geography and Urban Geography.

items.title: Environmental Geography (Human Geography)
items.lead: The Master Environmental Geography focuses on the relationship between humans and their ecosystem. Environmental challenges can be approached from different perspectives, which are analysed while taking spatial dynamics into account. You will examine the consequences of environmental changes on both local and global economies and study international climate change governance.

items.title: Urban Geography (Human Geography)
items.lead: The Master Urban Geography provides students with a deeper understanding of global and local processes that shape cities across the world. In our programme, we study processes of urbanization, urban inequality and every day urban life through a geographical lens, exploring how seemingly global phenomena take on place-specific forms and contribute to place-specific social and spatial challenges. You will thus learn to study cities not only from the perspective of the global, but also from the perspective of the local.

items.title: Political Economy (Political Science)
items.lead: How do global economic and political forces shape the lives and future of citizens, business, and civil society? Our Political Economy Master programme will teach you to answer these questions. The programme covers the ground from ‘economics for non-economists’ to understanding how the ‘rules of the game’ are shaped, to thinking about ‘winners’ and ‘losers’ of an open global economy and how that gives rise to ‘new’ conflicts. You will address the critical issues in global and comparative terms facing the developed and developing worlds, from Asia to Europe to the Americas. We will focus on contemporary challenges such as migration, the struggle for development, or better financial market governance.

items.title: Political Geography (Human Geography)
items.lead: The Master Political Geography focuses on three core themes: geopolitics, globalisation and governance. By examining these concepts, political geographies in our current globalised world are analysed and researched. Theories and methods in political geography are thoroughly studied before a thesis project in the field is conducted.

items.title: Cultural and Social Anthropology: Visual Anthropology (track)
items.lead: What becomes of anthropology when it is practiced in other media than the written word like photography or film? And what becomes of film and photography when they have anthropological pretensions? The visual anthropology track enables you to explore the possibilities of camera-based research.

items.title: Social Sciences
items.lead: The two-year Research Master's in Social Sciences offers you advanced training in current social science theory and innovative methodologies in a rigorous and multidisciplinary social science research environment.

items.title: International Development Studies
items.lead: The two-year Research Master's in International Development Studies focuses on development processes and transformations and shifting balances of power in the Global North and the Global South. During the programme, you will discuss societal transformation and development trajectories.

items.title: Urban Studies
items.lead: The two-year Research Master’s in Urban Studies deals with questions surrounding the increasing urbanisation of today’s world. Cities are characterised by economic, social, political and cultural opportunities, but also carry risks of social problems, inequality and security issues. In this programme, you will learn to research and analyse these challenges.

items.title: Cultural and Social Anthropology: Applied Anthropology (track)
items.lead: For students who wish to conduct research that has an applied character aimed at solving problems or contributing understanding where this is directly needed, we offer the possibility to specialize in Applied Anthropology.

items.title: Tinbergen Institute MPhil in Economics (Research Master)
Economics: Monetary Policy and Banking (track)
items.lead: Want to study Monetary Policy and Banking? This is a track within our Master's in Economics programme. Find out more about this track on our Economics programme webpages.

items.title: Economics: International Economics and Globalisation (track)
items.lead: Want to study International Economics and Globalisation? This is a track within our Master's in Economics programme. Find out more about this track on our Economics programme webpages.

items.title: Economics: Public Policy (track)
items.lead: Want to study Public Policy? This is a track within our Master's in Economics programme. Find out more about this track on our Economics programme webpages.

items.title: Actuarial Science and Mathematical Finance
items.lead: In the MSc Actuarial Science and Mathematical Finance we train you in the financial and mathematical analysis of complex risk management and insurance topics. If your mind is on mathematics and finance and if you would like to help companies gain insight into the financial consequences of risks, this programme could be for you.

items.title: Economics
items.lead: Are you interested in what makes the world tick? In the MSc Economics, leading experts share their research and insights on how to make the economy future proof. Ready to make an impact?

items.title: Actuarial Science and Mathematical Finance: Quantitative Risk Management (track)
items.lead: Want to study the Quantitative Risk Management track in the MSc Actuarial Science and Mathematical Finance programme? Find out more about this track on our MSc in Actuarial Science and Mathematical Finance programme webpages.

items.title: Economics: Honours programme
items.lead: Ready for an extra challenge? The MSc Economics Honours programme is an addition to the Master's in Economics programme. Find out more on our Economics programme webpages.

items.title: Economics: Markets and Regulation (track)
items.lead: Want to study Markets and Regulation? This is a track within our Master's in Economics programme. Find out more about this track on our Economics programme webpages.

items.title: Econometrics
items.lead: Prepare for a career in one of the most sought-after professions in the world today. The Master's in Econometrics (MSc) deals with statistical modelling, estimation and testing of economic models using economic and financial time series data. Unravel economic complexities in data, theories and markets. Become fluent in the application of advanced mathematical and statistical methods.

items.title: Economics: Behavioural Economics and Game Theory (track)
items.lead: Want to study Behavioural Economics & Game Theory? This is a track within our Master's in Economics programme. Find out more about this track on our Economics programme webpages.

items.title: Business Economics: Competition Law and Economics (track)
items.lead: Want to study Competition Law and Economics? This is a track within our Master's in Business Economics. Find out more about this track on our Business Economics webpages.

items.title: Actuarial Science and Mathematical Finance: General (track)
items.lead: Want to study the General track in the MSc Actuarial Science and Mathematical Finance programme? This is one of 2 tracks within the programme. Find out more about this track on our MSc in Actuarial Science and Mathematical Finance programme webpages.

items.title: Business Economics: Neuroeconomics (track)
items.lead: Want to study Neuroeconomics? This is a track within our Master's in Business Economics. Find out more about this track on our Business Economics webpages.

items.title: Econometrics: Complexity and Economic Behaviour (track)
items.lead: Want to study Complexity and Economic Behaviour? This is a track within our MSc Econometrics programme. Find out more about this track on our Econometrics programme webpages.

items.title: Econometrics: Financial Econometrics (track)
items.lead: Want to study Financial Econometrics? This is a track within our MSc Econometrics programme. Find out more about this track on our Econometrics programme webpages.

items.title: Economics: Development Economics (track)
items.lead: Want to study Development Economics? This is a track within our Master's in Economics programme. Find out more about this track on our Economics programme webpages.

items.title: Econometrics: Data Science and Business Analytics (track)
items.lead: Want to study Data Science and Business Analytics? This is a track within our Econometrics programme. Find out more about this track on our Econometrics programme webpages.

items.title: Business Economics
items.lead: This 1-year academic Master’s programme teaches you to conduct research in business economics subjects. Choose from 3 top-level tracks: Managerial Economics and Strategy, Competition Law and Economics or Neuroeconomics.

items.title: Data Science and Business Analytics
items.lead: Learn how to solve business-related problems using computational approaches and techniques, predictive analysis and data science; a highly sought-after combination on the job market. As a graduate of the MSc Data Science and Business Analytics you will acquire a unique combination of skills and the latest techniques for your first steps on the labour market.

items.title: Econometrics: Econometrics (track)
items.lead: Want to study Econometrics? This is a track within our MSc Econometrics programme. Find out more about this track on our Econometrics programme webpages.

items.title: Business Economics: Managerial Economics and Strategy (track)
items.lead: Want to study Managerial Economics and Strategy? This is a track within our Master's in Business Economics. Find out more about this track on our Business Economics webpages.

items.title: Fiscale Economie
items.lead: Met de master Fiscale Economie verdiep je je in complexe belastingvraagstukken en hun economische invloed op bedrijven. Onder andere door grondige analyses uit te voeren binnen de grenzen van het (inter)nationale belastingrecht. Afgestudeerd fiscaal economen van de Amsterdam School of Economics staan bekend om hun sterke economische én juridische onderlegging. Na afronding van de studie kun je terecht bij bijvoorbeeld een belastingadvieskantoor of bij de Belastingdienst.

items.title: Business in Society (joint Research Master's programme)
Business Data Science
items.lead: A two-year research master (120 EC) aiming to train future PhD students who will start their doctorate at one of the Schools in business and economics of the three partner universities: University of Amsterdam, Erasmus University Rotterdam, and Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam.

items.lead: Want to study Consumer Marketing? This is one of 8 tracks within our Master's in Business Administration. Find out more about this track on our MSc in Business Administration programme webpages.

items.lead: During this exciting Master’s programme you learn how to be more entrepreneurial. Thinking and feeling like an entrepreneur benefits your career as employee or business owner.

items.lead: Want to study Entrepreneurship and Innovation? This is one of 8 tracks within our Master's in Business Administration. Find out more about this track on our MSc in Business Administration programme webpages.

items.title: Business Administration (MSc)
items.lead: Are you ambitious as well as entrepreneurial and do you have a global mindset? Are you a Bachelor’s graduate with excellent marks? The MSc Business Administration offers you all the necessary knowledge and skills to start your international career in business. You can start the programme in September or February.

items.lead: Want to study Banking and Regulation? This is a track within our MSc Finance programme. Find out more about the track on our MSc Finance programme webpages.

items.lead: Want to study Entrepreneurship and Management in the Creative Industries? This is a track within our Master's in Business Administration. Find out more about this track on our MSc in Business Administration programme webpages.

items.title: Finance
items.lead: Start your financial career with the MSc in Finance at the Amsterdam Business School. With this programme you will gain a deep understanding of financial decision-making and markets. We will train you in a broad range of skills to take with you to your first employer. Choose one of 7 tracks and focus on the field that interests you most. Or consider our dual track in Finance and Real Estate Finance or our Duisenberg honours track in Corporate Finance and Banking and Regulation.

items.title: Accountancy and Control: Accountancy (track)
items.lead: Want to study Accountancy? This is a track within our Accountancy and Control programme. Find out more about this track on our Accountancy and Control programme webpages.
